content.title: Tesla's new FSD push looks like a gross money grab: they have questions to answer
technical_points: policy change: FSD stays with your Tesla as long as you own it
content.raw_content: Tesla is sending emails urging owners to purchase Full Self-Driving (FSD) before February 14, when the automaker switches to a subscription-only model. But in the email, Tesla appears to sneak in a policy change: FSD now only 'stays with your Tesla as long as you own it.' It also has contradicting information on its support page.

content.title: Accelerating our global growth: Waymo raises $16 billion investment round
content.raw_content: Waymo enters a new era with a $16 billion investment round valuing the company at $126 billion post-money. The financing was led by Dragoneer Investment Group, DST Global, and Sequoia Capital, with significant investments from Andreessen Horowitz and Mubadala Capital. This capital underscores that the age of autonomous mobility at scale has arrived.

content.title: Today, February 4, Waymo's Chief Safety Officer testifies before U.S. Senate Committee
content.raw_content: Waymo's Chief Safety Officer Dr. Mauricio Peña testified before the U.S. Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation regarding Waymo's mission, commitment to improving road safety, and data showing that Waymo is making roads safer in the cities where they operate. He discussed the critical role of federal leadership in establishing National AV rules.
